reviews.review_text: The CDs were defective. I tried two times and both packages would have several discs start in the middle and 4 and 5 were identical. Since I did this twice one would be wise to stay away from the audiobook.

A very impressive first novel. This story is set in Australia and the farming town is in the middle of a two year drought. I very much liked the atmospheric tone of the drought, it took on a character of its own. The story involves a current day tragedy and an unsolved death from twenty years prior. The narrative weaves well between the two stories with plenty of twists and secrets revealed.I loved the author's dedication which reads "To my parents, Mike and Helen, who always read to me".

I picked this book because of its award nomination, so I had high hopes. I was not disappointed. A balanced, realistic and measured crime novel. Not violent, not rushed and not insecure in seeking to create reader adrenaline surges. Similar to Sandford's Virgil Flowers stories, but with less of the macho American syndrome. True quality crime.

I read this on vacation and it held my interest. It took place in Australia, and I enjoyed learning about that locale and the characters the author created around it. It will keep you guessing until the end! I discovered it's a debut novel--but it was very well written. (The only minor criticism was that all nervous people chewed on their thumbnails.)

This is the best book I've read in a long time. Very believable without all the "twists" that make you say yeah right ,like that's gonna happen. The characters felt real, and I liked the suspense. This book wasn't overdone with good guys= supermen or women and the bad guys omnipotent or everybody dying right and left to make the story "suspenseful,"I highly recommend this
Best book I have read in a long time.  Kept my interest to the end.
I usually stick with the same authors. Saw this on amazon and gave it a try.Really enjoyed it. Rich characters and non stop suspenseLoved the ending.

The story was ok, but not what I expected after reading all the reviews. Perhaps my expectations were too high. I found parts of the story to be exceedingly slow...and it took me longer to finish this book than it usually does. After spending the last few weeks working my way through a variety of the Kindle Unlimited selections, I was disappointed that I'd paid $12.99 for this book.

You will be guessing from beginning to end with this well-told suspenseful thriller! Great story, great dialogue, intriguing characters!  I have already recommended it to my friends, and I can't believe that I bought it for $2.99 on Kindle!  I have paid more for much less!
Pace was so slow, I got bored and didn't finish the story.  Sorry, I wanted to like it.

title: The Dry

summary:
INSTANT NEW YORK TIMES BESTSELLER

A small town hides big secrets in The Dry, an atmospheric, page-turning debut mystery by award-winning author Jane Harper.

After getting a note demanding his presence, Federal Agent Aaron Falk arrives in his hometown for the first time in decades to attend the funeral of his best friend, Luke. Twenty years ago when Falk was accused of murder, Luke was his alibi. Falk and his father fled under a cloud of suspicion, saved from prosecution only because of Luke’s steadfast claim that the boys had been together at the time of the crime. But now more than one person knows they didn’t tell the truth back then, and Luke is dead.

Amid the worst drought in a century, Falk and the local detective question what really happened to Luke. As Falk reluctantly investigates to see if there’s more to Luke’s death than there seems to be, long-buried mysteries resurface, as do the lies that have haunted them. And Falk will find that small towns have always hidden big secrets.

“A breathless page-turner, driven by the many revelations Ms. Harper dreams up…You’ll love [her] sleight of hand…A secret on every page.” The New York Times

“One of the most stunning debuts I've ever read… Every word is near perfect.” David Baldacci
